subject: Philosophy
title: Owning Your Choices
description: A short lesson to help you apply Owning Your Choices.

hook.text: It's tempting to blame your parents, your boss, or society. Existentialists say: stop.

buildup.text: Sartre insisted that even in oppressive conditions, you choose your response to those conditions.

discovery.text: Taking ownership means saying 'I chose this' â€” even when the choice was between terrible options.

twist.text: This isn't victim-blaming. It's empowerment. If you accept your role, you can change it.

climax.text: Ownership doesn't remove pain. But it gives you agency in the middle of it.

punchline.text: Your life. Your choices. No one else's.

quiz.question: Why do existentialists emphasize owning your choices?
options: It gives you agency and the power to change
